result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin L Jackson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin L Jackson not in court.  Attorney Maryann Corea in court for Justin L Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date. Case adjourned to Br. 30.
Calendar call scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Justin L Jackson appeared by video.  Attorney Maryann Corea appeared by video for Justin L Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery. Case may be in DPA posture. TAD evaluation to be scheduled. 
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Justin L Jackson in court.     Josh Kather, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A.Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge  Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/19/2022@1:30p
